text:
How to remove all added files via git add -A
?
To remove all added files via git add -A, you can use the following command:
```
git rm --cached -r .
```
This will remove all files that have been added using git add -A and are now staged for commit. The -r option is used to remove directories and their contents as well.
summary: Sure, here are some steps to remove all added files via git add -A:
